reviews.review_msg: Although the course had WAY too much reading, she was an easy marker and responded well to her students. Do the readings, think critically and participate and you'll do well...She does however, have a long neck and weird stare.

Lectures were v. interesting and I enjoyed coming to class, though we were way too overloaded with readings. She had to keep pushing things back because we couldn't keep up. Good marker, gives multiple chances for feedback. Show up to class and it will reflect in your marks.

New to teaching. Not organized. Very young and quite in to her research. Changed the outline too much. Assignment expectations were not clear and led her to be an unfair marker. Not sure what she wanted from us. Course was okay.

Thank goodness I won't have to hear her talk anymore about her dissertation!!!!! This course was all about how she can't focus and teach...at least she will be in Africa for awhile as she would be better there. Anyhow great person, but does show favortism to those that can teach what she can't. Get the point D. Her assignments were ok, best part.

She is disorganized and spends an EXCESSIVE amount of time discussing her own research. She  attempts to discuss material she is not prepared to explain. Assignment expectations were unclear. The student presentations were the only fun part. I would not recommend this instructor until she develops her teaching skills.
She is very unorganized and frustrating to communicate with. I felt as though she only wanted to talk about her own work in class lectures. She expected too much and was self absorbed.

The most unorganized prof ever, however her assignments are easy and surprisingly enjoyable. Her lectures usually always comprise of her talking about her work in the down town east side. Barley go over readings and she rarley follows the syllabus she gives out. Great person and easy marker, but seems to busy with her discertation to teach properly
